DataElement.preferredName: Person Disease or Disorder High Risk Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Ind
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A response as to whether a person meets the eligibility criteria to participate in a clinical trial with regards to any abnormal condition of the body or mind at risk for potential future harm that may arise from some present action or attribute or condition.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Person Disease or Disorder High Risk Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A human being._Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function._The potential future harm that may arise from some present action or attribute or condition is almost certain._Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

Property.preferredName: Disease or Disorder High Risk Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
Property.preferredDefinition: Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.:The potential future harm that may arise from some present action or attribute or condition is almost certain.:Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

Concepts.definition: Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.
The potential future harm that may arise from some present action or attribute or condition is almost certain.
Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.

ReferenceDocuments.name: EA1141 CRF
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is patient suspected of being at high-risk for breast cancer, as defined by the ACS breast MR screening recommendations (lifetime risk of greater than or equal to 20-25%)

ReferenceDocuments.name: Is patient suspected of being
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is patient suspected of being at high-risk for breast cancer, as defined by the ACS breast MR screening recommendations (lifetime risk of >= 20-25%)

ReferenceDocuments.name: ECOG OPEN CheckList
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has pathological high risk disease been reported following central review?

ReferenceDocuments.name: OPEN Form
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has pathological high risk disease been reported by credentialed pathologist?

ReferenceDocuments.name: OPEN Checklist
ReferenceDocuments.description: Did the credentialed pathologist determine risk disease burden?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG CRF Text 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is the disease high clinical risk, defined as: low histologic grade with primary tumor size greater than 3 cm, intermediate histologic grade with primary tumor size greater than 2 cm, or high histologic grade with primary tumor size greater than 1 cm?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CCTG_01
ReferenceDocuments.description: Pathologic high-risk factors on diagnostic biopsy: high histologic grade (poorly differentiated), mucinous or signet ring histology, lymphatic/vascular or perineural invasion.
